description.narrative:
The owner of the leading FMCG distributor in Tajikistan, plans to create a new entity, Amiri LLC, to launch chocolate and confectionary production in Dushanbe. Production is planned to start by the end of December for chocolate products, targeting the middle class consumers, with nationwide distribution.
Amiri will be the first modern chocolate operation in Tajikistan, competing against imported brands. The project includes investment in: (i) the renovation of existing production premises, formerly used for storage; (ii) equipment for chocolate production; and (iii) working capital. IFC funding will be used to support the purchase of modern chocolate processing equipment.
The existing distribution company, Tajero, was established in 2002 and has since built strong relations with leading international companies to distribute and market FMCG products in Tajikistan. The new company, Amiri, will take advantage of the Tajero network for brand management, distribution and key shelf space to leverage Tajeros depth of expertise and strong relationships with retail players.

Through this Project, IFC will be investing with a local sponsor that has built a strong distribution business in a challenging environment and now is looking to start its own production in a predominantly import dependent market. With IFC's involvement, Amiri is well positioned to become a model production site through support from IFC on food safety, HACCP and environmental standards, and would be able to disseminate best practices through its distribution network. The Project's main beneficiaries will be financiers, employees, owners of small stores and consumers.

name.narrative: Amiri LLC is located in the Rudaki district of Dushanbe, Tajikistan. The site used to be an old storage facility which Mr. Gaibullozoda purchased in 2005 and fully renovated into modern storage and production complex. Part of the complex measuring 1,500 m2 is now being outfitted for chocolate production.
